bibl.title: Nero's Pet Hippopotamus (Suet. Nero 37, 2).
bibl.note: Suetonius' description of Nero's possession of a flesh-eating polyphagus of Egyptian origin should be read as an ambiguous description of the possession by Nero of a pet hippopotamus, as taken from an ambiguous source in Greek language.
bibl.seg: David Woods, Nero's Pet Hippopotamus (Suet. Nero 37, 2).

Suetonius' description of Nero's possession of a flesh-eating polyphagus of Egyptian origin should be read as an ambiguous description of the possession by Nero of a pet hippopotamus, as taken from an ambiguous source in Greek language.
